intro: Mapouria reducta var. pilosula, commonly known as the silky mapouria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
